locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the contrast between the 'thief' (societal decay, materialism, fear) and the 'abundant life' offered by Jesus. It uses historical anecdotes, social commentary on 1980s America, and the metaphor of being on the 'right road'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The text is used more as a thematic springboard than a verse-by-verse exposition. The focus is on the 'inside-out' nature of life.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts truths about the human condition and the nature of Christ's mission, shifting to direct address and assurance in the final third.
voorbeelden: I want to talk with you a little while on escape into life.
The truth is that our profound difficulty is a God-relationship difficulty.
If you are in Jesus Christ, you on the right road.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To comfort the listener amidst social 'distemper' and to reassure them of their identity in Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned as the nature of Jesus' words, but not explicitly invoked as the agent of the sermon's current effect.

voorbeelden: Flora Lewis wrote in a column...
The advertising industry is pouring billions of dollars...
Don't let anybody turn you around.
My God, they have influenced the world.
He died... that we might live forever.
If you are in Jesus, you're on the right road.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong toward the end; the 'right road' becomes a commissive assurance of God's presence.

voorbeelden: I am as certain as I stand here that there is no other way...
You are looking at what you are talking about.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with personal and traditional authority, but rarely uses first-person sacramental formulas (e.g., 'I declare to you').

indicatoren: Social commentary on pellagra and the advertising industry.
Third-person descriptions of Jesus' past actions.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of a lecture for the first 70% of the sermon.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the conclusion.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High emotional resonance but structurally late.
voorbeelden: If you are in Jesus, you're on the right road.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher as narrator and witness ('I remember', 'I want to talk').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation's struggle and assurance.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to anchor the 'right road' promise.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a descriptive distance, treating the Gospel as a topic of discussion.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life and society.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: It avoids pure moralism (Directive), but stays too long in Assertive.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Social crisis) to Commissive (The Right Road).
voorbeelden: Jesus is the life (Assertive) -> If you are in Him, you are on the road (Commissive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is effective but the 'Toezegging' (Promise) is brief compared to the setup.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you are in Jesus Christ (Indicative), don't let anybody turn you around (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a comforting word that eventually reaches a performative climax, but spends excessive time 'talking about' the world.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: You're on the right road. Straight ahead!
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The section on Thomas Jefferson and English Deists.
zwakke_punten.problem: Intellectualizes the sermon, delaying the encounter.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final minutes, but the majority is a lecture on social distemper.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a witness more than a mandatory of a present-tense miracle.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as having spoken in the past (Jesus said).
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher speaks as a guide/friend rather than a herald of the 'Now'.
tekstueel_bewijs: I want to talk with you a little while...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is mentioned in a quote from Jesus but not as the active power of the sermon.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's response to the 'road' metaphor.
tekstueel_bewijs: My words, they are spirit and they are life.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon acts as a means of grace in its final assurance.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am as certain as I stand here...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense and third-person verbs. Needs more second-person present-tense performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus said he was all about life.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Jesus stands here now to give you life.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from historical report to present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried under too much social analysis.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the 'Right Road' promise throughout the social critique.
voorbeeldzinnen: In this mean world, Christ promises you a different spirit.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the hearer's specific 'barricaded' heart directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: You may have locks on your door, but Christ enters your room.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good in the conclusion.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain this balance but start it earlier.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful rhetorical piece that eventually finds its performative footing, but risks losing the 'event' character in its long descriptive preamble.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the 'Right Road' isn't just a 'self-revelation' of the preacher's feelings, but a Declarative act that changes the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically beautiful, SAT shows the sermon's power is in the Commissive ('I am certain... you are on the road') rather than the anecdotes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'Jefferson' section is locutionarily interesting but illocutionarily weak, as it performs no specific grace-act.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: If you are in Jesus Christ, you on the right road.
Many of the founding fathers were English Deists.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Preacher as Storyteller' persona, which creates a high locutionary interest but delays the illocutionary 'impact' of the Gospel promise.
